title: Interface is a mess, AirPods Pro 2 and notifications don‚Äôt consistently work
text:
The interface is still an absolute mess with the organization of chats, meetings, and favorites seeming to be all jumbled together under the ‚ÄúChat‚Äù area. Seriously, meetings and chats need to be separated out and we need to be able define our own groups instead of just unlabeled Favorites. 

AirPods Pro 2 don‚Äôt work consistently, hang joining meetings, and drop out making the speaker look like a clown (this does not happen in other apps).

Notifications don‚Äôt always take you to the specific spot they‚Äôre talking about; looking at you, meeting started notifications!

Honestly don‚Äôt understand why this app is so well rated. No offense, but I would be embarrassed if I worked on this.

title: Teams Review
text: Honestly it‚Äôs a really great application to have at work since the user interface is very easy to navigate and understandable. The mobile feature makes having work on the phone a breeze and when you want to disconnect from work it‚Äôs just as easy! Far better to use then the next leading app and the ability for connecting devices to Teams is unbeatable. Thoroughly enjoy utilizing this vital tool at work daily, 10/10 for quality!

title: Full of bugs, not ready for Renae
text:
This is another MS product that they have released before it's ready and it's full of bugs.  That would be understandable if they actually responded to user bug reports and fixed them quickly, but some of these bugs have existed for years and therefore have persisted through countless releases. 

For example, this app will often show an unread message number babe on its icon, yet when the app is opened there are no unread messages anywhere.  Something like this should not be difficult for a company like MS with lots of high caliber coders.  It seems that they just don't care.

title: poorly poorly thought out product by a monopolist
text: This is what you get when you let 5 rival teams build a product. There are work and school versions vs home versions.  There are classic and new ‚Äúexperiences‚Äù. your calling partners will get stuck in endless login loops because microsoft insist on issuing 3rd party cookies from 3 different sites.  Microsoft will make you jump through login loops even if you just want to join a call as a guest.  Until your credentials are burned into every part of the OS they haven‚Äôt don‚Äôt their job. God help you if you need to work with two orgs and don‚Äôt want your identity constantly cross posted.  Flee while you can .. there are plenty of good alternatives out there.
